page.title: 02Hawkinge Aerodrome
page.content: There is a former aerodrome close to the village. The site is now agricultural land but there are plans to reopen the airfield for light planes. The aerodrome was in use from 1910 to 1961. During World War 1 the site was used by the Royal Flying Corps to ferry aircraft to St.Omer for service at the front. Hawkinge Aerodrome became famous during World War 2 as a front line station. The squadrons from Hawkinge were closely involved in the Battle of Britain. the main aircraft used at that time were Spitfires and Hurricanes. The former RAF camp is now a residential housing estate. The gymnasium is a hall used for community social functions.
